algorithms.name: compile a WebAssembly module
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="compile-a-webassembly-module" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">compile a WebAssembly module</dfn> from source bytes <var>bytes</var>, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let module be module_decode(bytes). If module is error, return error.
If module_validate(module) is error, return error.

algorithms.name: WebAssembly/validate(bytes)
algorithms.html: The validate(bytes) method, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let stableBytes be a copy of the bytes held by the buffer bytes.
Compile stableBytes as a WebAssembly module and store the results as module.

algorithms.name: construct a WebAssembly module object
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="construct-a-webassembly-module-object" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">construct a WebAssembly module object</dfn> from a module <var>module</var> and source bytes <var>bytes</var>, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let moduleObject be a new Module object.

algorithms.name: asynchronously compile a WebAssembly module
algorithms.html: To asynchronously compile a WebAssembly module from source bytes bytes, using optional task source taskSource, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Run the following steps in parallel:
Compile the WebAssembly module bytes and store the result as module.
Queue a task to perform the following steps. If taskSource was provided, queue the task on that task source.
If module is error, reject promise with a CompileError exception.
Construct a WebAssembly module object from module and bytes, and let moduleObject be the result.

algorithms.name: WebAssembly/compile(bytes)
algorithms.html: The compile(bytes) method, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let stableBytes be a copy of the bytes held by the buffer bytes.
Asynchronously compile a WebAssembly module from stableBytes and return the result.

algorithms.name: read-the-imports
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="read-the-imports" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">read the imports</dfn> from a WebAssembly module <var>module</var> from imports object <var>importObject</var>, perform the following steps:

steps.html: If module.imports is not empty, and importObject is undefined, throw a TypeError exception.
If Type(o) is not Object, throw a TypeError exception.
If externtype is of the form func functype,
If v has a [[FunctionAddress]] internal slot, and therefore is an Exported Function,
Let funcaddr be the value of v’s [[FunctionAddress]] internal slot.
Create a host function from v and functype, and let funcaddr be the result.
Otherwise, if <var>v</var> has a [[WrappedFunction]] internal slot,
Let func be the value of v’s [[WrappedFunction]] internal slot.
create a suspending function from func and functype, and let funcaddr be the result.
Let index be the number of external functions in imports. This value index is known as the index of the host function funcaddr.
Let externfunc be the external value func funcaddr.
If externtype is of the form global mut valtype,
If v implements Global,
If valtype is i64 and Type(v) is not BigInt,
If valtype is one of i32, f32 or f64 and Type(v) is not Number,
Let value be ToWebAssemblyValue(v, valtype). If this operation throws a TypeError, catch it, and throw a LinkError exception.
Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
Set the surrounding agent's associated store to store.
If externtype is of the form mem memtype,
If v does not implement Memory, throw a LinkError exception.
Let externmem be the external value mem v.[[Memory]].
If externtype is of the form table tabletype,
If v does not implement Table, throw a LinkError exception.
Let externtable be the external value table tableaddr.
If externtype is of the form tag attribute functype,
If v does not implement Tag, throw a LinkError exception.
Let externtag be the external value tag tagaddr.

algorithms.name: create an exports object
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="create-an-exports-object" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">create an exports object</dfn> from a WebAssembly module <var>module</var> and instance <var>instance</var>, perform the following steps:

steps.html: If externtype is of the form func functype,
Assert: externval is of the form func funcaddr.
Let func be the result of creating a new Exported Function from funcaddr.
If externtype is of the form global mut globaltype,
Assert: externval is of the form global globaladdr.
Let global be a new Global object created from globaladdr.
If externtype is of the form mem memtype,
Assert: externval is of the form mem memaddr.
Let memory be a new Memory object created from memaddr.
If externtype is of the form table tabletype,
Assert: externval is of the form table tableaddr.
Let table be a new Table object created from tableaddr.
If externtype is of the form tag attribute functype,
Assert: externval is of the form tag tagaddr.
Let tag be a new Tag object created from tagaddr.

algorithms.name: initialize an instance object
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="initialize-an-instance-object" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">initialize an instance object</dfn> <var>instanceObject</var> from a WebAssembly module <var>module</var> and instance <var>instance</var>, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Create an exports object from module and instance and let exportsObject be the result.

algorithms.name: instantiate the core of a WebAssembly module
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="instantiate-the-core-of-a-webassembly-module" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">instantiate the core of a WebAssembly module</dfn> from a module <var>module</var> and imports <var>imports</var>, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.

If result is error, throw an appropriate exception type:

  • A LinkError exception for most cases which occur during linking.

  • If the error came when running the start function, throw a RuntimeError for most errors which occur from WebAssembly, or the error object propagated from inner ECMAScript code.

  • Another error type if appropriate, for example an out-of-memory exception, as documented in the WebAssembly error mapping.
Set the surrounding agent's associated store to store.

algorithms.name: asynchronously instantiate a WebAssembly module
algorithms.html: To asynchronously instantiate a WebAssembly module from a Module moduleObject and imports importObject, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Read the imports of module with imports importObject, and let imports be the result. If this operation throws an exception, catch it, reject promise with the exception, and return promise.
Run the following steps in parallel:
Queue a task to perform the following steps: Note: Implementation-specific work may be performed here.

Instantiate the core of a WebAssembly module module with imports, and let instance be the result. If this throws an exception, catch it, reject promise with the exception, and terminate these substeps.
Let instanceObject be a new Instance.
Initialize instanceObject from module and instance. If this throws an exception, catch it, reject promise with the exception, and terminate these substeps.

algorithms.name: instantiate a promise of a module
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="instantiate-a-promise-of-a-module" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">instantiate a promise of a module</dfn> <var>promiseOfModule</var> with imports <var>importObject</var>, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Upon fulfillment of promiseOfModule with value module:
Instantiate the WebAssembly module module importing importObject, and let innerPromise be the result.
Upon fulfillment of innerPromise with value instance.
Let result be the WebAssemblyInstantiatedSource value «[ "module" → module, "instance" → instance ]».
Upon rejection of innerPromise with reason reason:
Upon rejection of promiseOfModule with reason reason:

algorithms.name: WebAssembly/instantiate(bytes, importObject)
algorithms.html: The instantiate(bytes, importObject) method, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let stableBytes be a copy of the bytes held by the buffer bytes.
Asynchronously compile a WebAssembly module from stableBytes and let promiseOfModule be the result.
Instantiate promiseOfModule with imports importObject and return the result.

algorithms.name: WebAssembly/instantiate(moduleObject, importObject)
algorithms.html: The instantiate(moduleObject, importObject) method, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Asynchronously instantiate the WebAssembly module moduleObject importing importObject, and return the result.

algorithms.name: WebAssembly/JSTag
algorithms.html: The getter of the JSTag attribute of the WebAssembly Namespace, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let JSTagAddr be the result of getting the JavaScript exception tag.
Let JSTagObject be the result of creating a Tag object from JSTagAddr.

algorithms.name: Module/exports(moduleObject)
algorithms.html: The exports(moduleObject) method, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let kind be the string value of the extern type type.

algorithms.name: Module/imports(moduleObject)
algorithms.html: The imports(moduleObject) method, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let kind be the string value of the extern type type.
Let obj be «[ "module" → moduleName, "name" → name, "kind" → kind ]».

algorithms.name: Module/customSections(moduleObject, sectionName)
algorithms.html: The customSections(moduleObject, sectionName) method, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: For each custom section customSection of bytes, interpreted according to the module grammar,
Let name be the name of customSection, decoded as UTF-8.
Assert: name is not failure (moduleObject.[[Module]] is valid).
Append a new ArrayBuffer containing a copy of the bytes in bytes for the range matched by this customsec production to customSections.

algorithms.name: Module/Module(bytes)
algorithms.html: The Module(bytes) constructor, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let stableBytes be a copy of the bytes held by the buffer bytes.
Compile the WebAssembly module stableBytes and store the result as module.
If module is error, throw a CompileError exception.

algorithms.name: Instance/Instance(module, importObject)
algorithms.html: The Instance(module, importObject) constructor, when invoked, runs the following steps:

steps.html: Read the imports of module with imports importObject, and let imports be the result.
Instantiate the core of a WebAssembly module module with imports, and let instance be the result.

algorithms.name: create a fixed length memory buffer
algorithms.html: To create a fixed length memory buffer from a memory address memaddr, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let block be a Data Block which is identified with the underlying memory of memaddr.
Let buffer be a new ArrayBuffer with the internal slots [[ArrayBufferData]], [[ArrayBufferByteLength]], and [[ArrayBufferDetachKey]].

algorithms.name: create a resizable memory buffer
algorithms.html: To create a resizable memory buffer from a memory address memaddr and a maxsize, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let block be a Data Block which is identified with the underlying memory of memaddr.
Let buffer be a new ArrayBuffer with the internal slots [[ArrayBufferData]], [[ArrayBufferByteLength]], [[ArrayBufferMaxByteLength]], and [[ArrayBufferDetachKey]].

algorithms.name: initialize a memory object
algorithms.html: To initialize a memory object memory from a memory address memaddr, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let map be the surrounding agent's associated Memory object cache.
Let buffer be the result of creating a fixed length memory buffer from memaddr.

algorithms.name: create a memory object
algorithms.html: To create a memory object from a memory address memaddr, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let map be the surrounding agent's associated Memory object cache.
Let memory be a new Memory.

algorithms.name: Memory/Memory(descriptor)
algorithms.html: The Memory(descriptor) constructor, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: If descriptor["maximum"] exists, let maximum be descriptor["maximum"]; otherwise, let maximum be empty.
If maximum is not empty and maximum < initial, throw a RangeError exception.
Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
Let (store, memaddr) be mem_alloc(store, memtype). If allocation fails, throw a RangeError exception.
Set the surrounding agent's associated store to store.

algorithms.name: refresh the Memory buffer
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="refresh-the-memory-buffer" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">refresh the Memory buffer</dfn> of <var>memaddr</var>, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let map be the surrounding agent's associated Memory object cache.
Let buffer be the result of creating a fixed length memory buffer from memaddr.
Let block be a Data Block which is identified with the underlying memory of memaddr.

algorithms.name: grow the memory buffer
algorithms.html: To grow the memory buffer associated with a memory address memaddr by delta, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
If store is error, throw a RangeError exception.
Set the surrounding agent's associated store to store.

algorithms.name: dom-Memory-grow
algorithms.html: The grow(delta) method, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Return the result of growing the memory buffer associated with memaddr by delta.
If the top of the stack is not i32.const (−1),
Assert: Due to validation, frame.module.memaddrs[0] exists.
Let memaddr be the memory address frame.module.memaddrs[0].

algorithms.name: dom-Memory-toFixedLengthBuffer
algorithms.html: The toFixedLengthBuffer() method, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let fixedBuffer be the result of creating a fixed length memory buffer from memaddr.

algorithms.name: dom-Memory-toResizableBuffer
algorithms.html: The toResizableBuffer() method, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
Let resizableBuffer be the result of creating a resizable memory buffer from memaddr and maxsize.

algorithms.name: abstract operation HostResizeArrayBuffer
algorithms.html: The abstract operation HostResizeArrayBuffer takes arguments buffer (an ArrayBuffer) and newLength. It performs the following steps when called.

steps.html: Let map be the surrounding agent's associated Memory object cache.
Assert: buffer is the [[BufferObject]] of exactly one value in map.
Grow the memory buffer associated with memaddr by delta.

algorithms.name: initialize a table object
algorithms.html: To initialize a table object table from a table address tableaddr, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let map be the surrounding agent's associated Table object cache.

algorithms.name: create a table object
algorithms.html: To create a table object from a table address tableaddr, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let map be the surrounding agent's associated Table object cache.
Let table be a new Table.

algorithms.name: Table/Table(descriptor, value)
algorithms.html: The Table(descriptor, value) constructor, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: If elementType is not a reftype,
If descriptor["maximum"] exists, let maximum be descriptor["maximum"]; otherwise, let maximum be empty.
If maximum is not empty and maximum < initial, throw a RangeError exception.
Let type be the table type {min initial, max maximum} elementType.
Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
Set the surrounding agent's associated store to store.

algorithms.name: dom-Table-grow
algorithms.html: The grow(delta, value) method, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
If ref is error, throw a TypeError exception.
If result is error, throw a RangeError exception.
Set the surrounding agent's associated store to result.

algorithms.name: Table/length
algorithms.html: The getter of the length attribute of Table, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.

algorithms.name: Table/get(index)
algorithms.html: The get(index) method, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
If result is error, throw a RangeError exception.

algorithms.name: Table/set(index, value)
algorithms.html: The set(index, value) method, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
If ref is error, throw a TypeError exception.
Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
If store is error, throw a RangeError exception.
Set the surrounding agent's associated store to store.

algorithms.name: initialize a global object
algorithms.html: To initialize a global object global from a global address globaladdr, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let map be the surrounding agent's associated Global object cache.

algorithms.name: create a global object
algorithms.html: To create a global object from a global address globaladdr, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let map be the surrounding agent's associated Global object cache.
Let global be a new Global.

algorithms.name: ToValueType
algorithms.html: The algorithm <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="tovaluetype" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">ToValueType</dfn>(<var>s</var>) performs the following steps:

steps.html: Assert: This step is not reached.

algorithms.name: DefaultValue
algorithms.html: The algorithm <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="defaultvalue" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">DefaultValue</dfn>(<var>valuetype</var>) performs the following steps:

algorithms.name: Global/Global(descriptor, v)
algorithms.html: The Global(descriptor, v) constructor, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: If valuetype is v128 or exnref,
If mutable is true, let globaltype be var valuetype; otherwise, let globaltype be const valuetype.
Let store be the current agent’s associated store.
Set the current agent’s associated store to store.

algorithms.name: GetGlobalValue
algorithms.html: The algorithm GetGlobalValue(Global global) performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let store be the current agent’s associated store.
If globaltype is of the form mut valuetype where valuetype is v128 or exnref, throw a TypeError.

algorithms.name: Global/value
algorithms.html:
The getter of the value attribute of Global, when invoked, performs the following steps:

The setter of the value attribute of Global, when invoked, performs the following steps:

algorithms.name: Global/value
algorithms.html:
The getter of the value attribute of Global, when invoked, performs the following steps:

The setter of the value attribute of Global, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: Let store be the current agent’s associated store.
If valuetype is v128 or exnref, throw a TypeError.
If mut is const, throw a TypeError.
If store is error, throw a RangeError exception.
Set the current agent’s associated store to store.

algorithms.name: Global/valueOf()
algorithms.html: The valueOf() method, when invoked, performs the following steps:

algorithms.name: name of the WebAssembly function
algorithms.html: The <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="name-of-the-webassembly-function" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">name of the WebAssembly function</dfn> <var>funcaddr</var> is found by performing the following steps:

steps.html: Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
If <var>funcinst</var> is of the form {type <var>functype</var>, hostcode <var>hostfunc</var>},
Assert: hostfunc is a JavaScript object and IsCallable(hostfunc) is true.
Let index be the index of the host function funcaddr.
Let index be the index of moduleinst.funcaddrs where funcaddr is found.

algorithms.name: a new Exported Function
algorithms.html: To create a new Exported Function from a WebAssembly function address funcaddr, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let map be the surrounding agent's associated Exported Function cache.
Let steps be "call the Exported Function funcaddr with arguments.".
Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
Let name be the name of the WebAssembly function funcaddr.

algorithms.name: coerce JavaScript arguments
algorithms.html: To coerce JavaScript arguments from a functype and a list of JavaScript arguments argValues, perform the following steps

steps.html: If parameters or results contain v128 or exnref, throw a TypeError. Note: the above error is thrown each time the [[Call]] method is invoked.

algorithms.name: call an Exported Function
algorithms.html: To call an Exported Function with function address funcaddr and a list of JavaScript arguments argValues, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
Let args be the result of coercing arguments (functype,argValues).
Set the surrounding agent's associated store to store.
If ret is error, throw an exception. This exception must be a WebAssembly RuntimeError exception, unless otherwise indicated by the WebAssembly error mapping.
If ret is THROW ref.exn exnaddr, then:
Let jsTagAddr be the result of getting the JavaScript exception tag.
Throw the result of retrieving a host value from payload[0].
Let exception be a new Exception created from exnaddr.

algorithms.name: coerce WebAssembly arguments
algorithms.html: To coerce WebAssembly arguments from a list of parameterTypes and a list of JavaScript arguments arguments, perform the following steps

steps.html: If parameterTypes contain v128, throw a TypeError.

algorithms.name: coerce a JavaScript return
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="coerce-a-javascript-return" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">coerce a JavaScript return</dfn> from a JavaScript <var>ret</var> and a list of <var>results</var> types, perform the following steps:

steps.html: If method is undefined, throw a TypeError.
Let wasmValues be a new, empty list.
If values’s size is not resultsSize, throw a TypeError exception.
For each <var>value</var> and <var>resultType</var> in <var>values</var> and <var>results</var>, paired linearly,

algorithms.name: coerce a JavaScript exception
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="coerce-a-javascript-exception" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">coerce a JavaScript exception</dfn> from a JavaScript exception <var>v</var>, perform the following steps:

algorithms.name: create a host function
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="create-a-host-function" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">create a host function</dfn> from the JavaScript object <var>func</var> and type <var>functype</var>, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let stored settings be the incumbent settings object.
Let hostfunc be a host function which performs the following steps when called with arguments arguments:
Prepare to run script with relevant settings.
Prepare to run a callback with stored settings.
Let jsArguments be the result of coerce WebAssembly arguments(parameters,arguments).
Let result be the result of Completion(Call(func, undefined, jsArguments)).
Clean up after running a callback with stored settings.
Clean up after running script with relevant settings.
Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
Return the result of performing coerce a JavaScript return on resultTypes and ret.
Set the surrounding agent's associated store to store.

algorithms.name: throw a JavaScript exception
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="throw-a-javascript-exception" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">throw a JavaScript exception</dfn> from the JavaScript object <var>v</var>, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let type be the result of getting the JavaScript exception tag.
Set the surrounding agent's associated store to store.
Execute the WebAssembly instructions (ref.exn address) (throw_ref).

algorithms.name: ToJSValue
algorithms.html: The algorithm ToJSValue(w) coerces a WebAssembly value to a JavaScript value by performing the following steps:

steps.html: Assert: w is not of the form v128.const v128.
Assert: w is not of the form ref.exn exnaddr.
If w is of the form i64.const u64,
Return ℤ(i64 interpreted as a mathematical value).
If w is of the form i32.const i32,
Return 𝔽(i32 interpreted as a mathematical value).
If w is of the form f32.const f32,
If f32 is +∞ or −∞, return +∞𝔽 or -∞𝔽, respectively.
Return 𝔽(f32 interpreted as a mathematical value).
If w is of the form f64.const f64,
If f64 is +∞ or −∞, return +∞𝔽 or -∞𝔽, respectively.
Return 𝔽(f64 interpreted as a mathematical value).
If w is of the form ref.null t, return null.
If w is of the form ref.i31 u31,
If w is of the form ref.struct structaddr, return the result of creating a new Exported GC Object from structaddr and "struct".
If w is of the form ref.array arrayaddr, return the result of creating a new Exported GC Object from arrayaddr and "array".
If w is of the form ref.func funcaddr, return the result of creating a new Exported Function from funcaddr.
If w is of the form ref.host hostaddr, return the result of retrieving a host value from hostaddr.
If w is of the form ref.extern ref, return ToJSValue(ref).

algorithms.name: retrieving a host value
algorithms.html: For retrieving a host value from an host address hostaddr, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let map be the surrounding agent's associated host value cache.

algorithms.name: ToWebAssemblyValue
algorithms.html: The algorithm ToWebAssemblyValue(v, type) coerces a JavaScript value to a WebAssembly value by performing the following steps:

steps.html: Let u64 be the unsigned integer such that i64 is signed_64(u64).
Let u32 be the unsigned integer such that i32 is signed_32(u32).
Let n be an implementation-defined integer such that canon32 ≤ n < 2signif(32).
Let n be an implementation-defined integer such that canon64 ≤ n < 2signif(64).
If type is of the form ref null heaptype,
Else if match_valtype(type, ref null extern),
Let ref be ToWebAssemblyValue(v, ref any).
Else if v is an Exported Function and match_valtype(type, ref null func),
Let funcaddr be the value of v’s [[FunctionAddress]] internal slot.
Else if v is a Number and v is equal to ? ToInt32(v) and ℝ(v) < 230 and ℝ(v) ⩾ -230,
Let u31 be the unsigned integer such that i31 is signed_31(i31).
Else if v is an Exported GC Object,
Let objectaddr be the value of v’s [[ObjectAddress]] internal slot.
Let objectkind be the value of v’s [[ObjectKind]] internal slot.
Let map be the surrounding agent's associated host value cache.
If a host address hostaddr exists such that map[hostaddr] is the same as v,
Let host address hostaddr be the smallest address such that map[hostaddr] exists is false.
Let store be the current agent’s associated store.
Assert: This step is not reached.

algorithms.name: WebAssembly/promising(wasmFunc)
algorithms.html: The promising(wasmFunc) function, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: If IsCallable(wasmFunc) is false, throw a TypeError.
If wasmFunc does not have a [[FunctionAddress]] internal slot, throw a TypeError.
Let builder be a new AbstractClosure with no parameters that captures wasmFunc and performs run a Promising function when called.

algorithms.name: run a Promising function
algorithms.html: The algorithm to run a Promising function from the JavaScript object wasmFunc and a list of WebAssembly values arguments consists of the following steps:

steps.html: Let funcaddr be the value of wasmFunc’s [[FunctionAddress]] internal slot.
Let runner be a new AbstractClosure with no parameters that captures promise, funcaddr, and arguments and performs the following steps when called:

algorithms.name: evaluate a Promising function
algorithms.html: The algorithm to <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="evaluate-a-promising-function" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">evaluate a Promising function</dfn>(<var>promise</var>, <var>funcaddr</var>, <var>arguments</var>) consists of the following steps:

steps.html: Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
Let args be the result of coercing arguments (functype,arguments).
Let map be the surrounding agent's associated Execution Context Status map.
Let ec be the currently executing execution context, i.e., the execution context that is at the top of the surrounding agent's current execution context stack.
Assert: map does not contain any entry for ec.
Add an entry mapping ec to active in map.
Assert: If control reaches here, we have done waiting for suspended imports.
If the entry for ec in map is not active then throw a WebAssembly SuspendError exception. Otherwise, remove the entry for ec from map.
Set the surrounding agent's associated store to store.
If result is error, throw a WebAssembly RuntimeError exception, unless otherwise indicated by the WebAssembly error mapping.
Otherwise, if result is of the form throw exnaddr,
Assert: result is a list of WebAssembly values.

algorithms.name: Suspending/Suspending(jsFun)
algorithms.html: The Suspending(jsFun) constructor, when invoked, performs the following steps:

steps.html: If IsCallable(jsFun) is false, throw a TypeError.

algorithms.name: create a suspending function
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="create-a-suspending-function" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">create a suspending function</dfn> from a JavaScript function <var>func</var>, with type <var>functype</var> perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let stored settings be the incumbent settings object.
Let hostfunc be a host function which performs the following steps when called with arguments arguments:
Let async_context be the surrounding agent's running execution context.
Let map be the surrounding agent's associated Execution Context Status map.
If the entry for async_context in map is not active, then:
Perform throw a JavaScript exception with a SuspendError exception.
Prepare to run script with relevant settings.
Prepare to run a callback with stored settings.
Let jsArguments be the result of coerce WebAssembly arguments(parameters,arguments).
Clean up after running a callback with stored settings.
Clean up after running script with relevant settings.
Let type, payload and opaqueData be the result of coercing the JavaScript exception ret.[[Value]].
Otherwise, if size of ret is 1 and IsPromise(ret.[[Value]][0]):
Set the entry for async_context in map to paused.
Let awaitResult be the result of performing Completion(Await(promise)).
If the entry for async_context in map is not paused then:
Perform throw a JavaScript exception with a SuspendError.
Otherwise, set the entry to active.
Let type, payload and opaqueData be the result of coercing the JavaScript exception ret.[[Value]].
Otherwise, return the result of performing coerce a JavaScript return on resultTypes and awaitResult.
Otherwise, return the result of performing coerce a JavaScript return on resultTypes and ret.
Let store be the surrounding agent's associated store.
Set the surrounding agent's associated store to store.
